action_title: Ponto-Caspian gammarids: Dewater (dry out) the habitat
key_messages:
Key Messages:

A replicated, controlled laboratory study from PolandÂ found that lowering water levels in sand killed three species of invasive freshwater shrimp, although one species required water content levels of 4% and below before it was killed.
background_information:
Background information and definitions:
Draining invaded waterbodies may offer a tool for localised eradication or population reduction of gammarid shrimps.
